head.title: Compressed Data; Royalties Sought On Forgotten Patent

hedline.hl1: Compressed Data; Royalties Sought On Forgotten Patent

abstract.p: British Telecommunications, citing forgotten 14-year-old patent, claims ownership of linking technology that lets Web users move around Internet by clicking on text and pictures; seeks royalties from Internet service providers in United States (S)

block.p: Dusting off a 14-year-old patent, British Telecommunications is claiming ownership of the linking technology that lets Web users move around the Internet by clicking on text and pictures. The company has begun sending letters to Internet service providers in the United States asking them to pay royalties.

Patent specialists say British Telecommunications has a difficult case to prove. But they expect the number of such cases to rise as people try to apply old and new patents to broad areas of the Internet.
